Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery skyphos or kantharos; interior glazed black; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of part of three draped figures, the central one to left holding a staff (long chiton in added white with black dotted cross decoration and ovolo pattern at neck, himation in added red with double incised lines at edge by hand) holding a staff; at right, part of figure with incised pattern on garment; at left, trace of garment in red.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B600.51)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0351) (Phase 1)
